Articles.Content:
lol did someone hack the ksp forums or is there a reason for the new default profile pic

Edited August 7, 2019 by Loskene

It's just been deleted and gone back to the broken image link it's been on the last day or so.

I see you out there, IT guy who thinks it's ok to do backend testing on the live build

Edited August 7, 2019 by Loskene
I've also never seen a broken image link, though I'll admit it's possible I've just not seen your avatar for the past few days. Your profile pic is like a lot of people's, a silhouette of a Kerbal.

13 hours ago, 5thHorseman said:

I've also never seen a broken image link, though I'll admit it's possible I've just not seen your avatar for the past few days. Your profile pic is like a lot of people's, a silhouette of a Kerbal.

I think I wasn't clear. For a good half hour before I posted this thread every profile with the default (no) avatar had that as a picture. I should've taken a screenshot of the homepage, it was kind of funny. Disappeared in between posting this thread and the first reply, to be replaced by the broken image link and now the old kerbal silhouette is back.

Huh I wasn't on at that time so I can't confirm it, but seeing as you're the only one who saw it it may have been some weird cache issue. The forum's busy enough that someone else should have seen something.
That's cool,man! It could be super cool if it lasted)
